name: Lupin flour
description: Regulated allergen in gluten-free products with cross-reactivity to peanuts

name: Undeclared added sugars
description: Misrepresentation of sweetener content in 'no sugar added' products

name: PFAS in food packaging
description: Migration of perfluoroalkyl substances from packaging materials

name: Bacillus cereus (emetic strain)
description: Heat-stable toxin causing rapid-onset vomiting in starchy foods

name: Organic fraud
description: Conventional products misrepresented as organic

name: Ethylene oxide residues
description: Banned fumigant detected in imported food ingredients

name: Insect protein allergens
description: Cross-reactivity with crustacean and dust mite allergies

name: Buckwheat
description: An emerging allergen in gluten-free products, unrelated to wheat despite its name.

name: Pea Protein
description: Increasingly used in plant-based foods; may cross-react with peanut allergies.

name: Mustard Oil
description: Distinct from mustard seeds; common in South Asian cuisine and topical use.

name: Corn (Maize)
description: Often overlooked but can trigger IgE-mediated reactions.

name: Kiwi
description: Common allergenic fruit with cross-reactivity to latex and birch pollen.

name: Lentils
description: Frequent allergen in Mediterranean/Middle Eastern diets.

name: Nutrient imbalances
description: Disproportionate levels of nutrients

name: Improper formulation
description: Incorrect ingredient ratios or formulations
sources: Infant formula with improper nutrient balance

name: Missing essential ingredients
description: Absence of required components
sources: Specialty medical foods lacking required elements

name: Excessive moisture content
description: Water content above acceptable levels
sources: Dried foods with excess moisture leading to spoilage
Meat products with water added beyond regulatory limits

name: Incorrect fat composition
description: Fat content or composition that differs from specifications
sources: Dairy products with fat content below labeled claims
Oils with incorrect fatty acid profiles

name: Incorrect vitamin/mineral fortification
description: Over- or under-fortification of vitamins/minerals beyond declared levels

name: Undisclosed preservative levels
description: Preservatives (e.g., sulfites, nitrates) exceeding regulatory limits or undeclared

name: Protein adulteration
description: Dilution of protein content with non-protein fillers (e.g., melamine, nitrogen-rich compounds)

name: Incorrect fatty acid profile
description: Deviation from declared omega-3/omega-6 ratios or trans-fat levels

name: Fiber content misrepresentation
description: Inaccurate soluble/insoluble fiber ratios or overstated total fiber content

name: Heavy metals
description: Toxic metals that can accumulate in the body

name: Persistent organic pollutants (POPs)
description: Chemical substances that persist in the environment and bioaccumulate

name: Persistent organic pollutants (POPs) - Per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS)
Radioactive contaminants
description: Radionuclides that can contaminate food sources

name: Microplastics
description: Plastic particles <5mm from environmental degradation, found in aquatic food chains

name: Perchlorate
description: Industrial chemical contaminating water/soil, disrupts thyroid function

name: Dioxin-like PCBs
description: PCB congeners that mimic dioxin toxicity, persistent in animal fats

name: Chromium (Hexavalent)
description: Industrial carcinogen contaminating water and soil

name: Pesticide transformation products
description: Toxic breakdown products of pesticides (e.g., DDT→DDE)

name: Nanoparticles (engineered)
description: Manufactured nanoparticles from industrial use entering food chain

name: Preservatives
description: Substances that prevent or inhibit spoilage

name: Food colorings
description: Substances that add or restore color

name: Flavor enhancers
description: Substances that enhance existing flavors

name: Sweeteners
description: Natural and artificial substances that provide sweetness

name: Packaging migrants
description: Chemicals that can transfer from packaging into food

name: Packaging migrants - Phthalates
sources: Food processing equipment with PVC parts

name: Packaging migrants - Semicarbazide
sources: Plastic gaskets in metal lids of glass jars

name: Processing equipment materials
description: Substances from equipment used in food production

name: Processing equipment materials - Mineral oil hydrocarbons
Printing inks
description: Inks used on food packaging materials

name: Adhesives
description: Substances used to seal or construct packaging

name: Adulteration
description: Adding inferior or foreign substances to food

name: Adulteration - Melamine in milk products
description: Addition to artificially increase apparent protein content

name: Adulteration - Sudan dyes in spices
description: Addition of industrial dyes to enhance color

name: Adulteration - Dilution of olive oil with cheaper oils
description: Mixing premium olive oil with lower quality oils

name: Substitution
description: Replacing an ingredient with a similar, cheaper alternative

name: Substitution - Species substitution in seafood
description: Selling lower-value fish species as premium varieties

name: Substitution - Honey adulteration
description: Diluting honey with sugar syrups or other sweeteners

name: Mislabeling
description: False or misleading product information

name: Mislabeling - False country of origin
description: Claiming products are from regions known for quality

name: Mislabeling - Falsely labeled organic products
description: Conventional products sold as organic

name: Counterfeit products
description: Fake products made to resemble established brands

name: Honey adulteration with corn syrup
description: Dilution of pure honey with cheaper sweeteners like high-fructose corn syrup

name: Extra virgin olive oil dilution
description: Mixing premium EVOO with lower-grade olive oils or seed oils

name: Organic food fraud
description: Conventional products sold as organic without certification

name: Seafood species substitution
description: Mislabeling cheaper fish as premium species (e.g., tilapia as red snapper)

name: Spice adulteration with fillers
description: Adding bulking agents like sawdust, starch or dyes to spices

name: Milk protein adulteration
description: Adding nitrogen-rich compounds to fake protein content

name: Genetically modified crops
description: Plants with modified genetic material

name: Genetically modified animals
description: Animals with modified genetic material

name: Genetically modified microorganisms
description: Modified bacteria or fungi used in food production

name: Unauthorized GM material
description: Presence of unapproved GM elements in food

name: Gamma irradiation
description: Treatment using gamma rays from radioactive sources

name: Electron beam irradiation
description: Treatment using accelerated electrons

name: X-ray irradiation
description: Treatment using X-rays generated by machine sources

name: Bacteria - Bacillus cereus
sources: Left at room temperature after cooking

name: Plant toxins - Pyrrolizidine alkaloids
sources: Honey from plants containing these alkaloids

name: Marine biotoxins - Ciguatoxin
sources: Large reef fish such as barracuda, grouper, snapper

name: Marine biotoxins - Domoic acid (Amnesic shellfish toxin)
Marine biotoxins - Scombrotoxin (histamine)
sources: Dark meat fish like tuna, mackerel, bonito

name: Novel protein sources
description: Non-traditional sources of protein

name: Novel protein sources - Cultured meat
description: Lab-grown meat from animal cells

name: Novel protein sources - Single-cell proteins
description: Proteins derived from microorganisms

name: Novel ingredients
description: Newly discovered or newly used food components

name: Nanomaterials in food
description: Engineered particles at nanoscale used in food applications

name: Cleaning and sanitizing agents
description: Residues from food processing equipment cleaning

name: Lubricants
description: Substances used in food processing machinery

name: Airborne contaminants
description: Substances from the production environment

name: Combustion byproducts
description: Compounds formed during combustion processes near food
sources: Polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons from nearby sources

name: Labeling issues
description: Problems with product labeling

name: Foreign language labeling
description: Product information not in required language

name: Storage and handling instructions
description: Improper or missing instructions

name: Shelf-life concerns
description: Inaccurate product durability information

name: Packaging integrity
description: Compromised packaging that may affect product safety

name: Helminths (worms) - Anisakis
sources: Raw or undercooked fish and seafood

name: Insecticides
description: Chemicals used to control insect pests

name: Herbicides
description: Chemicals used to control weeds

name: Herbicides - Glyphosate
sources: Residues in grains, legumes, and other crops

name: Fungicides
description: Chemicals used to control fungal diseases in crops

name: Multiple residues
description: Presence of more than one pesticide residue

name: Unauthorized pesticides
description: Pesticide residues from compounds not approved for use

name: Acrylamide
description: Forms during high-temperature cooking of carbohydrate-rich foods

name: Polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs)
description: Form during combustion processes and high-temperature cooking

name: Heterocyclic amines (HCAs)
description: Form during high-temperature cooking of protein-rich foods

name: Furan
description: Forms during heat treatment processes

name: 3-MCPD and glycidyl esters
description: Form during oil refining processes

name: Trans fatty acids
description: Form during partial hydrogenation of oils

name: Inadequate processing
description: Insufficient treatment to ensure food safety

name: Process deviations
description: Failures to follow established processing parameters

name: Cross-contamination
description: Transfer of hazards from one food or surface to another

name: Equipment malfunctions
description: Failures in processing equipment that affect food safety

name: Mycotoxins in feed
description: Toxins produced by fungi in feed materials

name: Persistent organic pollutants
description: Environmental contaminants that persist and bioaccumulate

name: Prohibited animal proteins
description: Animal proteins banned in certain animal feeds
sources: Ruminant proteins in ruminant feed (BSE prevention)

name: Antibiotics - Chloramphenicol
description: Broad-spectrum antibiotic banned in food-producing animals in many countries

name: Antibiotics - Nitrofurans
description: Synthetic antibacterials banned in food-producing animals in many countries

name: Nutritional additives
description: Substances providing nutrients

name: Zootechnical additives
description: Substances affecting animal performance or environmental impact

name: Sensory additives
description: Substances that improve feed palatability

name: Technological additives
description: Substances used for technological purposes

name: Unauthorized additives
description: Substances not approved for use in feed

name: Allergenic processing aid residues
description: Residues from allergen-containing processing aids that remain in final products

name: Incomplete allergen declarations
description: Failure to declare potential allergen cross-contact or minor ingredients containing allergens

name: Novel plant protein allergens
description: Emerging allergic reactions to plant proteins not traditionally considered major allergens

name: Allergen cross-contamination during production
description: Undeclared allergens due to shared equipment, improper sanitation, or production scheduling errors

name: Mineral oil hydrocarbons (MOSH/MOAH)
description: Migration from recycled cardboard packaging into dry foods

name: Vegan product cross-contact
description: Dairy/egg contamination in plant-based products

name: Cultured meat cell abnormalities
description: Unintended cell mutations in lab-grown protein products

name: Industrial dyes in spices
description: Addition of non-food colorants to enhance appearance

name: Thermal process contaminants
description: Harmful compounds formed during high-temperature cooking
